title: heavy_barrel
body:
[b]Heavy Barrel[/b] (ヘビー・バレル [i]Hebī Bareru[/i]) is a 1987 overhead shooting arcade [[video game]] by [[Data East]]. The game is set in the near future when two lone special unit commandos try to infiltrate a secret [[radiation symbol|nuclear]] [[missile]] complex that was captured by hi-tech enemy paramilitary forces. 

The name of the game comes from an in-game super weapon. The "Heavy Barrel" is a very powerful high-energy portable plasma [[cannon]] capable of destroying any enemy in the game with a single shot. The weapon has a wide arc of fire and can be fired as fast as the player's trigger finger permits, but after thirty seconds its use is exhausted, at which point the bearer reverts to his previous weaponry. It can be found scattered in six pieces hidden among random power-up containers during the game.

Heavy Barrel was ported to the Apple II Pc and DOS in 1989. The [[NES]] and [[Famicom]] versions were developed by Sakata SAS and published by Data East in North America and Japan in 1990. In February 2010, Majesco Entertainment released a port of Heavy Barrel for the [[Nintendo]] [[Wii]] as part of the "Data East Arcade Classics" disc.

title: keith_wayne
body:
A recurring character in the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku|Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series from [[atlus|Atlus]]. 

Keith Wayne is a brash and egotistical youth who competes in the Gouketsuji tournaments and tends to flirt with pretty girls so he can date them. He also used to run in a gang, but due to the feelings of his father, he quit. In later entries, it's implied that he and [[annie_hamilton|Annie Hamilton]] are a couple.

His son is [[chris_wayne|Chris Wayne]], who was featured in [[groove_on_fight|Groove On Fight]].

title: princess_sissy
body:
A character in the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku|Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series.

She was the final boss of [i]Shin Gouketsuji Ichizoku: Toukon Matrimelee[/i]. She is a princess from a land called "Certain Country" and uses a magical box and hidden weapons to fight her opponents. She is polite and formal, but can have a mean and trickster side.

She also has an older brother named Prince who was made a playable character in [i]Gouketsuji Ichizoku Matsuri Senzo Kuyou[/i].

title: thin_nen
body:
A recurring character in the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku|Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series.

He is a corrupt and greedy Buddhist monk whose desires center solely on food, money, and women, and uses tricky and powerful attacks to fight his opponents. He is generally considered a parody of monk characters. He was renamed "Chinnen" since [[Matrimelee|Shin Gouketsuji Ichizoku: Toukon Matrimelee]].

title: hattori_saizou
body:
破鳥 才蔵

A recurring character in the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku|Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series from [[Atlus]].

Saizo Hattori is a ninja who is a sociopath, and makes attempts to try and become a more socially acceptable person through the series. He often has a habit of wearing his helmet and mask to avoid contact with people, and speaks in a code language called "popapepa" so they won't know what he's saying.

His cousin is [[hattori_takumi|Takumi Hattori]], who debuted in the latest game in the series, [i]Gouketsuji Ichizoku Matsuri Senzo Kuyou[/i].

title: ooyama_rin

One of the new characters introduced in [i]Gouketsuji Ichizoku Matsuri Senzo Kuyou[/i] of the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku|Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series.

She is a young schoolgirl who uses two forms of karate to fight her opponents and has a very calm and polite personality. She is also the cousin sister of [[ooyama_reiji|Reiji Ooyama]].

title: savoia_s.21
body:
A fictional [[flying boat]] in the [[Studio Ghibli]] movie and manga [[Kurenai no Buta]]. Based on the real-life "Macchi M.33":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macchi_M.33, it is a scarlet-red open-cockpit monoplane with a single overwing-mounted engine, a yellow underside and a fin flash that displays the Royal Italian Air Force [i]tricolore[/i] overlaid with the coat of arms of the city of Genoa.

There are three variations of the S.21. The original version can be seen in post #705377; post #740389 shows the version with the uprated engine and chin-type radiator. This also has provision for seating a single passenger in front. A third version with [[contra-rotating propellers]] was included with a discarded movie epilogue sequence. The S.21 was armed with two 7.92mm [[machine gun|machine guns]].

body:

A 1992 [[Studio Ghibli]] feature film based on [[Miyazaki Hayao]]'s manga Hikoutei Jidai (飛行艇 時代, "The Age of the Flying Boat"), that was previously serialized in the magazine Model Graphix. Set in the 1920s, it is about a bounty hunter in the Adriatic who, transformed into a pig, makes a living by hunting down air pirates in the region. It is also known by the title "Porco Rosso."

title: donald_curtis
body:
Ace pilot hired by the flying pirate alliance in [[Studio Ghibli]]'s [[Kurenai no Buta]] to get rid of their nemesis, [[Porco Rosso (character)|Porco Rosso]]. His character design apparently draws from period film stars such as Errol Flynn, with his thin mustache, square jawline, and short brown hair. His flying uniform mimics the color scheme of his plane--yellow [[scarf]], blue [[jacket]] and trousers, and white [[gloves]], [[belt]] and [[knee boots]].

title: sweden_(hetalia)
body:
"Human" name: [b]Berwald Oxenstierna[/b] (Bēruvarudo Okisensusheruna)

[i][[Axis Powers Hetalia]][/i]'s [[personification|representation]] of Sweden. A large man with [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Usually seen wearing a dark blue naval uniform and wears [[glasses]].

Seemingly the only character in Hetalia with a confirmed sexuality, Sweden is very close to [[Finland (Hetalia)|Finland]], to the point of referring to him as his 'wife', despite the latter's objections.

title: finland_(hetalia)
body:
"Human" name: [b]Tino Väinämöinen[/b] (Tino Vainamainen)

[i][[Axis Powers Hetalia]][/i]'s [[personification|representation]] of Finland. A young man with [[blonde hair]] and [[purple eyes]] (changed to [[brown eyes|brown]] in the anime). Usually seen wearing a light blue military uniform.

Seems to play the role of [[Santa Claus]] in the Hetalia-verse, since Santa Claus is said to live in northern Finland.

Has a [[dog]] named [[Hana-tamago]]. Some strips feature him, [[Sweden (Hetalia)|Sweden]] and [[Sealand (Hetalia)|Sealand]] (and [[Ladonia (Hetalia)|Ladonia]], after his introduction) in a family-like relationship.
other_names: ティノ・ヴァイナマイネン

title: golden_knight_(elona)
body:
The [[golden_knight_(elona)|Golden Knights]] are the divine servants of [[Opatos of Earth]] in the game [[Elona]], and can become player party members for the faithful of Opatos.  Due to their service to their patron god of strength, they have an absurdly high carrying capacity, capable of carrying an additional 300 kg of weight above and beyond what their stats otherwise would allow them to carry.  

Golden Knights are always female.

Salient characteristics of the Golden Knights are their long, straight [[blonde hair]], their blue-and-white dress, and are often seen carrying a rather massive [[mace]].  

Like most Elona characters, Golden Knight is just a "class name", and a personal name is randomly assigned to them upon spawning.  In-game, they would appear as something like "Omikka the golden knight".

title: shena_the_draw
body:
A minor NPC from [[Elona]], Shena the Draw is a bar hostess from the initial town of Vernis.  (A more literal translation of her name would be "Shina the poster girl".)

Shena wears a brown dress with a white [[apron]], and has a white cloth over her head.  She has [[blonde hair]] in [[twin braids]].

Shena is only relevant to the game for a single early-game quest, and the fact that most Vernis residents will occasionally comment upon her: "Everyone loves Shena's ass" or "You could bounce a quarter off Shena's ass!".  

She also has tangential relation to an artifact throwing weapon called Shena's Panty, which is rarely dropped by nobles at parties. It notably deals confusion and mind damage, rather than normal physical damage.

title: gaiares
body:
[b]Gaiares[/b] (ガイアレス [i]Gaiaresu[/i]) is a Japanese side-scrolling 2D space shooter [[video game]] released in 1990 by Telenet Japan for the [[Sega Mega Drive]] System and subsequently for its American counterpart, the [[Sega Mega Drive]].

The name is supposedly a combination of "Gaia" ([i]Mother Earth[/i]) and a shortened form/abbreviation of the word "rescue" ([i]Res[/i]), which is the main objective of the battle taking place within the storyline.

The game is notable for its music, its graphics and its extremely high level of difficulty. Gaiares also featured one of the most original and unique weapon power-up systems in the shooters genre to date: The "TOZ System", a satellite device that can be fired out like the [[R-Type]] [[bit_(r-type)|"Bit"]], except each time it comes into contact with an enemy, it inherits and learns its weapon configuration. In total there are 18 different weapons to be captured and each one varies depending on the strength meter and the type of enemy.

title: mc.200_saetta
body:
An early [[World War II|World War II]] Italian fighter-bomber, the MC.200 [i]Saetta[/i] ("Lightning") was a single-seat low-wing monoplane that first flew in 1937. Its radial engine gave it a distinctive appearance, as did the raised pilot's seat and semi-enclosed canopy. It could carry up to 320 kg (705 lbs) of bombs underwing and was armed with 2 12.7mm machine guns.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* [[MC.202 Folgore]]
* [[MC.205 Veltro]]

body:

The twin-pontoon [[seaplane]] was powered by a "radial engine":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radial_engine and had a crew of two under a long greenhouse canopy. Armament included 2 [[machine gun|machine guns]], 2 wing [[cannon]], and 2 50kg (110 lb) bombs.

title: fw_200
body:
Four-engined [[airplane]] developed by German company Focke-Wulf Flugzeugbau AG just prior to the outbreak of [[World War II|World War II]] as a long-range airliner. The war saw the militarization of the Condor with the addition of underwing hardpoints, bomb bays and defensive gun emplacements. It was used in reconnaissance, anti-shipping, troop transport, and cargo carrier roles.

h4. See also

* Wikipedia: "Focke-Wulf Fw 200 Condor":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Focke-Wulf_Fw_200
* Youtube: "silent clip of pre-war Fw 200 Condor airliner":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PQ9KntTSyG0

title: ta_152
body:
A further development of the German [[World War II|World War II]] [[Fw 190]], designed by Kurt Tank and built by Focke-Wulf. It was originally intended to produce at least three versions, but only a few of the the slender-winged H-series high-altitude interceptor went into service in 1945, too late to have any serious effect on the war.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Focke-Wulf Ta 152":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Focke-Wulf_Ta_152
* "Warbirds Resource Group Ta 152 page":http://www.warbirdsresourcegroup.org/LRG/ta152h.html

title: b-25_mitchell
body:
Twin-engined medium [[bomber]] used in [[World War II|World War II]] by Allied air forces. The H-tailed B-25 employed either freefall bombs or forward-firing [[cannon]] or [[machine gun|machine guns]] for surface attack. A few variants were used in maritime patrol and reconnaissance roles.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "North American B-25 Mitchell":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_B-25_Mitchell

title: ju_52
body:
A three-engined [[airplane]] built by German manufacturer Junkers in the 1930s. The Ju 52 served in civilian and [[military]] roles as an airliner, freighter, and [[World War II|World War II]] troop transport. It was notable for its use of corrugated "duralumin":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duralumin skin. The military version had 2 [[machine gun|machine guns]] for self-defense.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Junkers Ju 52":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junkers_Ju_52

title: avia_s-92
body:
A twin-engine [[jet]] fighter built in Czechoslovakia immediately after [[World War II|World War II]]. Basically a slightly upgraded [[Me 262]],  all surviving aircraft were removed from service in 1951, when more advanced Soviet jets entered the inventory.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* "S-92 Turbina":http://www.millionmonkeytheater.com/S-92.html

title: cant_z.506
body:
Twin-float Italian [[seaplane]] that was used in [[World War II|World War II]] as a bomber, air-sea rescue, and reconnaissance craft. It was powered by 3 radial engines and had a wooden fuselage and wings, while its floats were of "duralumin":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duraluminium. A crew of five could defend themselves with 4 machine guns; offensive armament included up to 1,200 kg (2,600 lb) of ordnance or 1 [[torpedo]].

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "CANT Z.506":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cant_Z.506

His nickname was frequently mistaken for 井上淳弐 (Inoue Junji). So, he decided to use 井上純一 for "his 'Chinese Wife' comic book":http://blog.livedoor.jp/geek/archives/51282205.html published by Enterbrain. He actually used the name "Inoue Junji" in his very early days, though.

title: tehmzin
body:
A character from the [[Macross]] series. He appears in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series from 2008.

[b]Tehmzin[/b] is an alien [[Zentradi]] [[giant]] [[warrior]] who looks a lot like [[Quamzin Kravshera]] from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982. He is also a [[cyborg]].

title: elmo_kridanik
body:
A character from the [[Macross]] universe.

He appears in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV anime series from 2008 and its 2009 animated movie adaptation, [[Macross Frontier: Itsuwari No Utahime]]. 

[b]Elmo Kridanik[/b] is a middle aged [[purple hair]]ed [[Zentradi]] who wears glasses. He is [[Ranka Lee]]'s artistic manager.

He is a [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross|Space War I]] veteran.

title: plasma_sword
body: A type of [[science fiction]] sword that uses [[plasma]] energy (an extremely high temperature ionized gas) to cut through anything.

title: transformers_shattered_glass
body:
A [[science fiction]] series from the [[Transformers]] franchise.

[b]Transformers: Shattered Glass[/b] is the fictional multiverse and associated toys and storylines that sprung from BotCon 2008's initial exclusive toyset and comic. 

It is a Transformers take on the old sci-fi warhorse of an evil alternate universe, (akin to [[Star Trek]]'s Mirror Universe and [[DC comics]]' Earth-Three) where the [[decepticon|bad guys]] are good, the [[autobot|good guys]] are bad, and (mostly) everyone has different paint schemes. 

It comes complete with facial hair for the evil versions of certain good guys.
other_names: シャッタード・グラス

title: uchuu_kyoudai
body:
[b]Space Brothers[/b] (宇宙兄弟, [i]Uchū Kyōdai[/i]) is a Japanese [[Science fiction]] manga series by Koyama Chūya which has been serialized in Kodansha's Weekly Morning since January 2008. 

The plot tells the story of [[Nanba Hibito]] and [[Nanba Mutta]], two brothers who become involved in [[space]] exploration.

It has been nominated twice for the Manga Taishō, in 2009 and 2010. In 2011, it won the award for best general manga at the 56th Shogakukan Manga Awards and at the Kodansha Manga Award (shared with Umino Chica's [[March Comes in Like a Lion]]). 

An anime adaptation by A-1 Pictures began airing in Japan from April 1, 2012. 

It was also adapted into a live action film that premiered on May 5, 2012.

title: 2000_ad
body:
A [[Science fiction]] comics anthology magazine from England.

[b]2000 AD[/b] is a weekly British science fiction-oriented comic. As a comics anthology it serialises a number of separate stories each issue (known as "progs") and was first published by IPC Magazines in 1977, the first issue dated 26 February. IPC then shifted the title to its Fleetway comics subsidiary which was sold to Robert Maxwell in 1987 then Egmont UK in 1991. Fleetway continued to produce the title until 2000, when it was bought by Rebellion Developments.

It is most noted for its [[Judge Dredd]] stories, and has been contributed to by a number of artists and writers who became renowned in the field internationally, such as Alan Moore, Neil Gaiman, Grant Morrison, Bryan Talbot, Brian Bolland and Mike McMahon. Other notable characters in 2000 AD include [[Judge Anderson]], [i]Rogue Trooper[/i], [i]Strontium Dog[/i] and [i]ABC Warriors[/i].

h4. See also

* [[Dredd]]

title: judge_dredd
body:
A fictional [[Science fiction]] [[Cyberpunk]] character from the [[2000 AD]] comics and the 2012 [[Dredd]] film.

[b]Judge Joseph Dredd[/b] is a an American law enforcement officer in a massive violent city of the future ([[Mega-City One]]) where uniformed heavy armored and armed "Judges" combine the powers of [[police]], judge, jury and executioner. Dredd and his fellow Judges are empowered to arrest, sentence, and even execute criminals on the spot. 

The character was created by writer John Wagner and artist Carlos Ezquerra, although editor Pat Mills also deserves some credit for early development.

Judge Dredd is amongst the UK's best known home-grown comic characters. So great is the character's name recognition that his name is sometimes invoked over similar issues to those explored by the comic series, such as the police state, authoritarianism, and the rule of law. 

Judge Dredd was named the Seventh Greatest Comic Character by the British magazine Empire. In 2011, IGN ranked him 35th in the Top 100 Comic Book Heroes.

h4. See also

* [[Lawgiver]]
* [[Judge Anderson]]

* [[RoboCop]]

title: judge_anderson
body:
A fictional [[Science fiction]] [[Cyberpunk]] character from the [[2000 AD]] and the [[Dredd]] 2012 film. 

Like her mythical namesake [i]Cassandra[/i] (the character from [i]The Iliad[/i] that could see the future), [b]Judge Cassandra Anderson[/b] has psychic powers. In addition to being able to sense approaching danger and foresee events of the near future, as did her namesake, she also has telepathy. This allows her to read other people's minds and use mental attacks. These abilities allowed her to be a member of [[Mega-City One]]'s corps of "Judges" as member of the Psi Division, which includes all Judges possessing psychic abilities.

Anderson started as a supporting player in the comic stories of [[Judge Dredd]] from 2000 AD and eventually rose in prominence and became the star of her own series, which are entitled [i]Anderson: Psi-Division[/i]. 

She was created by writer John Wagner and artist Brian Bolland in 1980. Since 1988, Anderson has been written almost exclusively by Alan Grant, often working with artist Arthur Ranson.

title: mega-city_one
body:
A fictional massive and futuristic, crime infested decaying city from the [[2000 AD]] [[Science fiction]] [[Cyberpunk]] comic series and the 2012 [[Dredd]] film.

[b]Mega-City One[/b] is a huge fictional city-state covering much of what is now the Eastern United States in the [[Judge Dredd]] comic book series and its spinoff series. 

The exact geography of the city depends on which writer and artist has done which story, but from its first appearance it has been associated with New York City's urban sprawl; originally it was presented as a future New York, which was retconned as the centre of a "Mega-City One" in the very next story.

The city evolved out of a growing urban conurbation stretching from Boston to Washington, which took form in the 21st century to cope with the escalating population crisis in America and - due to the high crime rate - led to the introduction of the "Judge" system.

title: contra:_shattered_soldier
body:
[b]Contra: Shattered Soldier[/b], published in Japan as [b]Shin Contra[/b] (真魂斗羅?, [i]"True Contra"[/i]) is a [[military]] [[Science fiction]] shooter [[video game]] that is part of the [[Contra]] series by [[Konami]]. 

It was developed by Team Kijirushi, a group of staff members within Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo, and released for the [[PlayStation 2]] in 2002. 

The game marks a return to the two-dimensional gameplay style employed by the series prior to [i]Contra: Legacy of War[/i].

h4. See also

* [[lucia_(contra)|Lucia]]

title: neo_contra
body:
[b]Neo Contra[/b] (ネオコントラ?) is the tenth [[video game]] in the [[Contra]] [[military]] [[Science fiction]] shooter series by [[Konami]]. 

It was developed by Team Neo Kijirushi, a group of staff members within Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo, and released for the [[PlayStation 2]] in 2004. 

The game is a direct follow-up to [[Contra: Shattered Soldier]] and is another departure from the traditional scrolling shooter formula from previous games by setting the action in overhead 3D stages.

h4. See also

* [[Bill Rizer]]
* [[yagyuu_jaguar_genbei|Genbei Yagyu]]

She is considered one of the major characters in [[Cosmic Break]]'s story, and is also a NPC in the game.

title: azami_(kagerou_project)
body: Character from [[Kagerou Project]]. Full-blooded Medusa. Grandmother of [[Kozakura Marry]] and creator of the Heat Haze world. She gives a young Mary the Queen Snake (the snake that can control all of the others) when she was on the verge of death after her [[kozakura_shion|mother]] and her were attacked in [[souzou_forest_(vocaloid)|Souzou Forest]].

title: emperor_penguin_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park. Part of [[penguins_performance_project_(kemono_friends)|Penguins Performance Project]] as "Emperor" ("Koutei").

The Emperor Penguin ([i]Aptenodytes forsteri[/i]) is the largest and heaviest of all extant penguins. It lives in and around Antartica and is the best known penguin species.

Emperor, like the other Penguins, wears a black and white hoodie after their species' plumage with the sleeves ending as mittens, emulating the flippers. In her case, the hood has a yellow hood. She also wears it open, revealing her white leotard (or swimsuit) with a wide collar fading up to yellow as well as [[large_breasts|her physique]]. She also wears thighhighs, accentuating the impact of her greater height compared to the others. She has long black hair with [[hair_over_one_eye|a long bang covering up her left eye]]. The thin orange streak implies that this represents the penguin's beak.
other_names: コウテイペンギン(けものフレンズ)

title: imperial_german_flag
body:
The national flag of the [[Germany|German Empire]]. It consists of three equal horizontal bars of black, white and red. It is sometimes seen defaced with the [[iron cross]], which was the marine jack of the German Empire.

This flag and the [[Imperial War Flag]] are often used as substitutes of the [[Nazi Flag]] or [[Nazi War Ensign]], which are illegal in Germany.

h4. See Also

* [[Imperial War Flag]]

title: nazi_war_ensign
body:
The war [[flag]] and war ensign used by [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] from 1935-1945. It was based on the [[imperial_war_flag|Imperial German war flag]], and features a red background with four black arms emanating from an off-center white circle with a black [[swastika]], and an [[iron cross]] in the canton.

h4. See Also

* [[Nazi Flag]]
* [[Imperial War Flag]]

title: hajime_sorayama
body: Hajime Sorayama was born in Ehime Prefecture, Japan. He graduated from Chuo Art School in 1969. His style is very unique in that he combines fetishes and themes typically seen in hentai with a more "western" drawing technique. He is most famous for his series of sexy robot women and "gynoids."

title: olivia_de_berardinis
body: Olivia de Berardinis attended the New York School of Visual Arts. She worked as a freelance artist for a while, but financial insecurity soon forced her to seek out commercial jobs. She found steady work painting erotica for men's magazines. It is evident in her work that pin-up models such as Bettie Page and Marilyn Monroe have influenced her greatly. Another common theme is ballerinas.

title: boris_vallejo
body:
Born in Lima, Peru, Boris attended the National School of Fine Arts in his native country before immigrating to the United States in 1964.

He has since done a great volume of work for the Fantasy field, having worked for virtually every major publishing house with a science fiction/fantasy line. Boris has also illustrated for album covers, video box art and motion picture advertising.

title: shikkaku_ishi
body:
H-game

The “hero” of this one was majoring in medicine, but was expelled from the university due to playing around (it must’ve been pretty bad to get him expelled!). However, it would appear that his brother graduated at the university with flying colors. His brother has always been the bane of his existence--one-upping him in everything. Now the brother has been working as a doctor at a local hospital and has been making quite nice reputation for himself. He’s now off to vacation with his fiancée, and our protagonist sees this as an opportunity to take his place and ruin his brother’s perfect situation (and have a little fun along the way). Oh yeah, I neglected to mention that the two brothers are twins, so they’ll be none the wiser.

http://www.getchu.com/soft.phtml?id=10346

title: suehirogari
body:
Japanese Manga-ka specializing in BDSM and Exhibitionism.  Combines other elements at will -- has done shota, loli, yuri and yaoi at random points in his career.  Used to have a website, however, it went down in early 2001 and was never re-uploaded.

Several of his works have been translated by the Munyu Heavy Industries team.

Early works of his were translated professionally by Eros Comix under the “Sexhibition” line, making Suehirogari one of the first hentai artists that many Manga fans from the 80s and 90s ever saw.

Rather infamous on 2ch for his lack of ability to keep up schedules.  Currently doing Somuniiru in Comic Megamilk (which is what Comic 0EX was renamed to) every other month.

title: tonarine_sai
body:
h4. Tonarine Sai (隣音サイ)

Could be seen as a Vocaloid derivative character, but notable in that her songs are actually sung by a real person (Utaite) and modified to sound like a [[Vocaloid]]. The name was created because she thought her neighbors would say she was too loud, since the artist for Sai apparently records out of her bedroom. Tonari (neighbor) ne (hey!) Urusai (Be quiet! (you're being noisy)).

As a character, she is a tall girl with long [[curly hair|curly]] [[pink hair]]. She dresses very similar to [[Hatsune Miku]], but wears a pair of spats (JP: spandex pants).

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: arima_senne
body:
An original character [[kashiwamochi yomogi|Yomogi]] often draws. Her full name is 有馬千音 (ありま せんね; Arima Senne), but Yomogi often call her 乳眼鏡さん (Chichimegane-san; breasts and glasses). Phonetically read, her name means "There isn't, is there?". 

Senne has long auburn hair, red eyes, glasses, a mole on her right breast near the nipple and a curly [[ahoge]]. Although, in some of Yomogi's early art of her, she is lacking some of these traits.

She is the younger sister of another character, [[Arima Senka]].

title: canards
body:
In aeronautics, control surfaces that are forward of an [[airplane]]'s main wing (and center of lift/gravity) and act similarly to tailplanes to provide pitch stability and control. 

The term [b]canard[/b] is derived from the French word for "duck," which was applied to early canard-using aircraft, as observers thought they resembled ducks in flight.

* Wikipedia: "Canard (aeronautics)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canard_aeronautics

* [[nakanishi takako|Takako Nakanishi]]
* [[okajima mizuki|Mizuki Okajima]]
* [[zaizen mai|Mai Zaizen]]

ENOZ is itself an homage to the girl band Zone.
